Pre-Game Insights: Both teams will be looking forward to playing in North Sound after batting was a struggle in the games in America
USA, in their first T20 World Cup appearance, are now A2, and will kickstart the Super Eight stage against South Africa
USA will hope for better batting conditions and no rain
South Africa are entering the Super Eight stage with an all-win record
South Africa's top-order batters have struggled for form and are averaging a mere 9.63 in the powerplay
USA showed their batting muscle in the opening game against Canada and then restricted Pakistan to a middling total in the second game
Saurabh Netravalkar has been a star for USA in the powerplay, where he's picked up three wickets and gone at an economy of 4.57
Anrich Nortje has performed consistently and is the joint-second-highest wicket-taker in the tournament with nine wickets
South Africa could bring in Tabraiz Shamsi for Keshav Maharaj in their last group game
It is expected to be an overcast morning in North Sound, but there is no rain forecast in the area on Wednesday
The teams batting second have won three out of four games here, with the surface good for batting
